revised_title: Discovery of Worms That Form Sponges and Their Role in Sponge Growth
tldr: The author, John Andrew Peyssonel, discovered worms that form sponges and observed their role in sponge growth. These worms live in the sponges' fibrous structure and are responsible for the sponges' growth and expansion. Peyssonel also described the worms' transparent bodies, their movement, and their ability to adapt to different sponge species.
